New York Trailheads

Find local trails. Go outside.

All Upstate New York Trails

Here, you'll find listings of area trails where you can get outside with a bike or a good pair of hiking shoes. We also share tips for planning excursions and staying safe outside.

Know a trail you'd like to see here? Let us know!

Mohawk-Hudson Bike-Hike Trail
A well-maintained trail following the Mohawk and Hudson Rivers through the Capital Region and further west
Palmertown Range
High up above Moreau Lake, the Palmertown Range includes an extensive trail system stretching seven miles across Adirondack foothills
Inman Pond
Hike out to a secluded pond nestled in the midst of the Lake George Wild Forest.
Prospect Mountain
A brief but somewhat strenuous hike to the top of a vantage point overlooking southern Lake George.
Sleeping Beauty Mountain
A moderately easy hike to a view of the southern portion of Lake George.
Shelving Rock Mountain
Following an old carriage road, this mountain offers a simple hike for families with a view of Lake George at the top.
Hadley Mountain
A relatively short hike to a rewarding view and a restored fire tower
Zim Smith Trail
A 9 mile multi-use trail extending from Halfmoon to Ballston Spa
Ushers Road State Forest
Located just off Northway Exit 10, this old growth forest contains a short loop trail, along with a connection to the Zim Smith Trail.
Buck Mountain
Buck Mountain offers one of the most beautiful views available of Lake George.
